content:
You're welcome! It sounds like you have a solid plan in place to give your aloe vera plant the care it needs to thrive. Repotting into a pot with better drainage will definitely help prevent waterlogged soil, and propagating using the leaf cutting method is a great way to share your plant with friends or create new ones for yourself.

Remember to be patient and gentle when handling the leaf cuttings, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or need further guidance. With a little care and attention, your aloe vera plant should do well and provide you with plenty of benefits, from soothing skin irritations to purifying the air.

Good luck with the repotting and propagation, and happy planting!
